concept.title: Window owning and non-window owning controls

section.title: Window-owning controls
section.p: Window-owning controls have the same size and position as a window in the display. Each window has a one-to-one relationship with the control that covers it, and shares its behavior with that control.

section.title: Non-window-owning controls
section.p: Non-window-owning controls typically cover only part of a window on the display, and must be contained in window-owning controls. They are faster and require fewer resources than window-owning controls.
Non-window-owning controls are assigned to window-owning controls by calling CCoeControl::SetContainerWindowL when the control is constructed.
For more information, see The run-time control hierarchy
